title: Calories in a PBJ Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in pbj sandwich, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for a standard serving with tips and variations.
assumptions: Standard: 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp peanut butter, 1 tbsp grape jelly; no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, brand of peanut butter/jelly, portion sizes, and preparation. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard PBJ sandwich provides about 400 kcal, with balanced carbs, protein, and fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a pbj sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 400 kcal for a standard PBJ sandwich.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a PBJ sandwich?
faqs.a: About 13 g protein, mostly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: Are PBJ sandwiches high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, around 15 g sugars mainly from jelly; opt for low-sugar versions to reduce.

faqs.q: How does bread type affect calories in pbj sandwich?
faqs.a: White bread adds more carbs; whole wheat can lower calories slightly and boost fiber.
It provides protein and fats but is carb-heavy with added sugars; balance with fruits or veggies.
